CONJUGATES: hymn (n) | hymns (n pl) | hymn (v) | hymns (v 3rd sg pres) | hymned (v past, pp) | hymning (v pres p)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French ymne, from Latin hymnus, from Ancient Greek húmnos (ὕμνος, 'song of praise').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A religious song or poem of praise and thanksgiving to God or a deity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一首赞美上帝或神灵的宗教歌曲或诗歌。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The congregation stood to sing the opening hymn.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 会众起立唱开场赞美诗。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To sing a hymn; to praise or celebrate in song.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 唱赞美诗；以歌唱赞美或颂扬。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ancient poets often hymned the deeds of heroes.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 古代诗人常以诗歌颂扬英雄的壮举。
